snippet: A prominent forensic psychiatrist concluded that a New York police officer charged with plotting to kidnap, rape, cook and eat women was not mentally ill, his lawyers said in a letter to prosecutors.
abstract: Prominent forensic psychiatrist concludes that suspended New York police officer Gilberto Valle, charged with plotting to kidnap, rape, cook and eat women, is not mentally ill, but suffers from deviancy that involves fantasies of sexual sadism, in which he derives excitement from imagined psychological or physical suffering of female victims.
lead_paragraph: A prominent forensic psychiatrist concluded that a New York police officer charged with plotting to kidnap, rape, cook and eat women was not mentally ill, his lawyers said in a letter to prosecutors.

headline.seo: Psychiatrist to Testify About Deviance at Officer’s Trial
headline.main: Psychiatrist to Testify on Deviance of Officer
headline.print_headline: Expert to Testify on Deviance of Officer
